summary: The 'Academic Partnerships Lead Us to Success Act' (A PLUS Act) allows states to submit a declaration of intent to the Secretary of Education to consolidate certain federal education funds. The bill aims to increase state and local flexibility in improving academic achievement and to reduce administrative burdens. States must use funds for educational purposes permitted by state law, ensure accountability to the public, and report student progress. The bill also outlines administrative expense limits and mandates equitable participation of private schools.
